Package mvc.controller

Class AbstractMenus

  • java.lang.Object
    • mvc.controller.AbstractMenus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Menus
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimplePortfolioMenu, SimpleStockMenu
    abstract class AbstractMenus
extends java.lang.Object
implements Menus
    The AbstractMenus class is an abstract class that houses common methods to all menus like prompting for the date, etc...

      Modifier Constructor Description
      protected AbstractMenus​(StockManager model, TextStockView view, java.util.Scanner sc)
      Controller will pass its parameters to the menu to help cut down on long switch statements in the controllerGo method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      abstract void apply​(java.lang.String input)
      The apply method takes in the input and applies a helper function to send the recorded input to the model/view.
      java.time.LocalDate promptDate​(java.lang.String time)
      The promptDate method is a general method that prompt the user for a date and records the input for use by the controller.

        public java.time.LocalDate promptDate​(java.lang.String time)
        Description copied from interface: Menus
        The promptDate method is a general method that prompt the user for a date and records the input for use by the controller.
        Specified by:
        promptDate in interface Menus
        Parameters:
        time - either "START", "END", etc... to label whether it is asking for the start date, end date, etc...
        Returns:
        the local date as recorded by the inputs
